comment.author: 18774104@N00
comment._content: Were these originally from the Tule Lake internment camp across the state line in California?  I know at the end of the war the barracks were sold off to homesteaders and a number are still in use in the area.

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Very good question. I don't know where they were originally and I am not sure that we have any information in our archive about the management or design of the camps. That information *might* be in the Extension Service Records, though those records are usually reports from the Extension agents who were in the field.

comment.author: 18774104@N00
comment._content: It seems the most likely camp, given the location? As a side note, Kevin Miyazaki, a photographer based here in Milwaukee, has been working on a project documenting the current use of the surviving Tule Lake barracks www.kevinmiyazaki.com/ (see "Camp Home" under the "Personal Projects" section - there's a horizontal scroll bar under the section text to view the photos). Both his father's family and my mother's family were interned there.

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Thank you for point me to this site, Miyazaki's pictures are amazing!

comment.author: 18774104@N00
comment._content:
Been meaning to post these links - this is the Tule Lake barrack building on display at the local history museum in Tulelake, CA (though I think all the camps had very similar architecture)

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content:
These images are really amazing, thanks for posting them!
Tiah

comment.author: 43621210@N08
comment._content:
Given the information you already  have, it does look most likely the building is from Tule Lake. I think the next closest would have been Minidoka (ID), but those were wood sided structures, and where my family was located.

A few other information resources would be Japanese American National Museum in LA and maybe the Oregon Nikei Foundation or Oregon Historical Museum in Portland, OR.

Relocation pictures always have such an emotional twinge for me.
